storyTitle: As Supervisor, I want to assign shift templates to employees to achieve accurate schedule creation

testCases.title: Verify successful assignment of shift template to employee for specific dates
preconditions: User is logged in with Supervisor role
At least one employee exists in the system
At least one shift template is available in ShiftTemplates table
Employee has no existing shifts for the selected date range
Schedule creation page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation page loads successfully with employee selection and calendar interface visible

steps.action: Select an employee from the employee dropdown list
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and their current schedule information is displayed

steps.action: Select a date range (start date and end date) for shift assignment
steps.expectedResult: Date range is highlighted on the calendar view and ready for template assignment

steps.action: Choose a shift template from the available shift templates list
steps.expectedResult: Shift template is selected and preview of shift details (time, duration, break) is displayed

steps.action: Click 'Assign Shift' button to assign the selected template to the employee for the chosen dates
steps.expectedResult: System processes the assignment and displays a success message confirming shift template assignment

steps.action: Verify the assigned shifts appear in the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Assigned shifts are visible in the calendar with correct dates, times, and employee name displayed

postconditions: Shift template is successfully assigned to employee in EmployeeSchedules table
Employee schedule is updated in the system
Calendar view reflects the new shift assignments
No validation errors or conflicts are present

testCases.title: Verify system detects and alerts supervisor for overlapping shift assignments
preconditions: User is logged in with Supervisor role
Employee already has an assigned shift on a specific date and time
Schedule creation page is accessible
Conflict detection rules are configured in backend

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation page loads with current employee schedules visible

steps.action: Select the employee who already has an existing shift assignment
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and existing shifts are displayed in the calendar view

steps.action: Select a date that overlaps with an existing shift for this employee
steps.expectedResult: Date is selected and available for template assignment

steps.action: Choose a shift template that has overlapping time with the existing shift
steps.expectedResult: Shift template is selected and ready for assignment

steps.action: Click 'Assign Shift' button to attempt assignment
steps.expectedResult: System validates the assignment and detects the overlapping shift conflict

steps.action: Review the conflict alert message displayed by the system
steps.expectedResult: Clear alert message is displayed indicating overlapping shift conflict with details of conflicting shifts (date, time, existing shift details)

steps.action: Verify that the conflicting shift was not saved to the schedule
steps.expectedResult: New shift is not added to EmployeeSchedules table and calendar view shows only the original shift

postconditions: Conflicting shift assignment is prevented
Original employee schedule remains unchanged
Supervisor is informed of the conflict with actionable information
System maintains data integrity

testCases.title: Verify system detects and alerts supervisor when work hour limits are exceeded
preconditions: User is logged in with Supervisor role
Employee has existing shifts that approach maximum work hour limits
Work hour limit rules are configured in the system
Schedule creation page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation page loads successfully

steps.action: Select an employee who is near their work hour limit for the week/period
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and current total work hours are visible

steps.action: Select a date within the current work period
steps.expectedResult: Date is selected on the calendar

steps.action: Choose a shift template that would cause total hours to exceed the maximum allowed work hour limit
steps.expectedResult: Shift template is selected showing shift duration

steps.action: Click 'Assign Shift' button to attempt assignment
steps.expectedResult: System validates total work hours and detects the limit violation

steps.action: Review the alert message displayed by the system
steps.expectedResult: Alert message clearly indicates work hour limit exceeded with details: current hours, proposed hours, maximum allowed hours, and period affected

steps.action: Verify the shift was not assigned to the employee
steps.expectedResult: Shift is not saved to EmployeeSchedules table and employee's total hours remain within limits

postconditions: Work hour limit violation is prevented
Employee schedule remains compliant with work hour regulations
Supervisor is alerted with specific violation details
No unauthorized shift assignment is recorded

testCases.title: Verify supervisor can manually adjust assigned shifts with successful validation
preconditions: User is logged in with Supervisor role
Employee has at least one assigned shift in the schedule
Schedule creation page is accessible
Validation rules are active in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation page loads with existing employee schedules visible in calendar view

steps.action: Select an employee with existing shift assignments
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and their assigned shifts are displayed in the calendar

steps.action: Click on an existing assigned shift in the calendar to open edit mode
steps.expectedResult: Shift details panel opens showing current shift information (start time, end time, break duration, shift type)

steps.action: Modify the shift start time to a valid new time that does not create conflicts
steps.expectedResult: New start time is entered and field accepts the input

steps.action: Modify the shift end time to a valid new time
steps.expectedResult: New end time is entered and field accepts the input

steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' or 'Update Shift' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates the manual adjustments against conflict rules and work hour limits

steps.action: Verify validation success message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Success message confirms shift has been updated with validation passed

steps.action: Check the calendar view for updated shift details
steps.expectedResult: Calendar displays the modified shift with new start and end times correctly reflected

postconditions: Shift is updated in EmployeeSchedules table with new times
Modified shift passes all validation rules
Calendar view reflects the updated schedule
Employee record shows the adjusted shift

testCases.title: Verify system prevents manual adjustment of shifts that would create conflicts
preconditions: User is logged in with Supervisor role
Employee has multiple assigned shifts
At least two shifts exist with potential for overlap if modified
Validation rules are configured and active

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation page loads with employee schedules visible

steps.action: Select an employee with multiple existing shifts
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and all assigned shifts are displayed in calendar view

steps.action: Click on a shift to open it for editing
steps.expectedResult: Shift edit panel opens with current shift details editable

steps.action: Modify the shift time to overlap with another existing shift for the same employee
steps.expectedResult: Modified time values are entered in the fields

steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' button to attempt saving the conflicting modification
steps.expectedResult: System runs validation and detects the scheduling conflict

steps.action: Review the validation error message displayed
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly states the conflict with details of overlapping shifts and specific times that conflict

steps.action: Verify the shift modification was not saved
steps.expectedResult: Original shift times remain unchanged in the calendar and EmployeeSchedules table

postconditions: Invalid shift modification is rejected
Original shift data remains intact
No scheduling conflicts exist in the system
Supervisor is informed of validation failure with clear reasoning

testCases.title: Verify employees receive notifications when schedule is created
preconditions: User is logged in with Supervisor role
Employee account exists with valid notification settings (email/SMS enabled)
Notification service is operational
At least one shift template is available

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation page loads successfully

steps.action: Select an employee from the employee list
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and ready for shift assignment

steps.action: Select a date range for the new schedule
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and highlighted on calendar

steps.action: Assign a shift template to the selected employee and dates
steps.expectedResult: Shift template is assigned successfully

steps.action: Click 'Confirm' or 'Save Schedule' button to finalize the schedule creation
steps.expectedResult: System saves the schedule and triggers notification process

steps.action: Verify notification confirmation message appears for the supervisor
steps.expectedResult: Message confirms that notification has been sent to the employee

steps.action: Check employee's notification inbox/email (if accessible in test environment)
steps.expectedResult: Employee receives notification containing schedule details: date, shift time, location, and any relevant instructions

postconditions: Schedule is created and saved in EmployeeSchedules table
Notification is successfully sent to employee
Notification delivery is logged in the system
Employee is informed of their new schedule assignment

testCases.title: Verify employees receive notifications when schedule is modified
preconditions: User is logged in with Supervisor role
Employee has an existing assigned shift
Employee notification settings are enabled
Notification service is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation page loads with existing schedules visible

steps.action: Select an employee with an existing shift assignment
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and current shifts are displayed

steps.action: Click on an existing shift to edit it
steps.expectedResult: Shift edit panel opens with current shift details

steps.action: Modify the shift details (change start time, end time, or date)
steps.expectedResult: Modified values are entered successfully

steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' button to save the modification
steps.expectedResult: System validates and saves the modified shift successfully

steps.action: Verify notification confirmation message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message indicates notification has been sent to employee about schedule modification

steps.action: Check employee's notification inbox/email for modification notice
steps.expectedResult: Employee receives notification with updated schedule details highlighting what was changed (original vs. new times/dates)

postconditions: Modified schedule is saved in EmployeeSchedules table
Notification is sent to employee about the modification
Notification delivery is logged
Employee is aware of schedule changes

testCases.title: Verify supervisor can view employee schedules in calendar view
preconditions: User is logged in with Supervisor role
Multiple employees have assigned shifts in the system
Schedule creation page is accessible
Calendar view feature is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation page loads with calendar view interface visible

steps.action: Verify calendar view displays current month/week by default
steps.expectedResult: Calendar shows current time period with date grid clearly visible

steps.action: Select an employee from the employee filter/dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Calendar view updates to show only the selected employee's shifts

steps.action: Verify assigned shifts are displayed on the calendar with shift details
steps.expectedResult: Each shift appears on correct date with visible information: shift time, duration, and shift type/template name

steps.action: Navigate to next week/month using calendar navigation controls
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates to show next time period with any scheduled shifts for that period

steps.action: Navigate back to previous week/month using calendar navigation controls
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates to show previous time period with historical shift data

steps.action: Switch calendar view mode (if available: day view, week view, month view)
steps.expectedResult: Calendar adjusts display format while maintaining all shift information visibility

steps.action: Click on a shift in the calendar to view detailed information
steps.expectedResult: Shift details panel opens showing complete information: employee name, date, start time, end time, break duration, location, and status

postconditions: Calendar view accurately displays all employee schedules
Supervisor can navigate through different time periods
All shift information is accessible and readable
Calendar view remains functional and responsive

testCases.title: Verify calendar view displays multiple employees' schedules simultaneously
preconditions: User is logged in with Supervisor role
At least 3 different employees have assigned shifts
Schedule creation page with calendar view is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation page loads with calendar view

steps.action: Select 'All Employees' or multiple employees from the filter options
steps.expectedResult: Calendar view updates to show shifts for all selected employees

steps.action: Verify shifts from different employees are visually distinguishable
steps.expectedResult: Each employee's shifts are displayed with different colors or clear labels showing employee names

steps.action: Check that overlapping shifts (different employees, same time) are both visible
steps.expectedResult: Calendar displays both shifts clearly without one hiding the other, possibly stacked or side-by-side

steps.action: Verify calendar legend or key is present
steps.expectedResult: Legend shows color coding or symbols used to differentiate between employees

postconditions: Multiple employee schedules are visible simultaneously
Calendar view provides clear visual differentiation between employees
All shift data is accessible and readable
Supervisor can effectively monitor team schedules

testCases.title: Verify system handles concurrent schedule edits by multiple supervisors
preconditions: Two supervisor accounts are logged in on different sessions/browsers
Same employee schedule is accessible to both supervisors
System supports concurrent editing with conflict resolution

steps.action: Supervisor 1: Navigate to schedule creation page and select an employee
steps.expectedResult: Supervisor 1 sees employee schedule and can edit

steps.action: Supervisor 2: Navigate to schedule creation page and select the same employee
steps.expectedResult: Supervisor 2 sees the same employee schedule and can edit

steps.action: Supervisor 1: Begin editing a shift (change start time)
steps.expectedResult: Shift enters edit mode for Supervisor 1

steps.action: Supervisor 2: Simultaneously edit the same shift (change end time)
steps.expectedResult: Shift enters edit mode for Supervisor 2

steps.action: Supervisor 1: Save the changes first
steps.expectedResult: Changes are saved successfully and database is updated with Supervisor 1's modifications

steps.action: Supervisor 2: Attempt to save changes after Supervisor 1
steps.expectedResult: System detects concurrent edit conflict and displays appropriate message (e.g., 'This shift has been modified by another user. Please refresh and try again.')

steps.action: Supervisor 2: Refresh the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Updated schedule reflects Supervisor 1's changes, Supervisor 2's unsaved changes are discarded or highlighted for review

postconditions: Data integrity is maintained
Only one set of changes is saved (first save wins or merge conflict resolution)
Both supervisors are aware of concurrent editing situation
No data loss or corruption occurs

testCases.title: Verify system performance with maximum concurrent schedule edits
preconditions: Test environment supports performance testing
100 supervisor accounts are available or can be simulated
Sufficient employee and shift data exists in the system
Performance monitoring tools are configured

steps.action: Prepare 100 concurrent supervisor sessions accessing the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: All 100 sessions successfully load the schedule creation interface

steps.action: Initiate simultaneous schedule edit operations from all 100 sessions
steps.expectedResult: System accepts all edit requests without crashing or timing out

steps.action: Monitor system response time for each edit operation
steps.expectedResult: Response time remains within acceptable limits (e.g., under 3 seconds per operation)

steps.action: Execute save operations from all 100 sessions simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: All save operations are processed successfully without data loss or corruption

steps.action: Verify database integrity after concurrent operations
steps.expectedResult: All schedule changes are correctly saved in EmployeeSchedules table with no duplicate or missing entries

steps.action: Check system logs for errors or warnings during concurrent operations
steps.expectedResult: No critical errors are logged; system handles load gracefully

steps.action: Verify API endpoint performance metrics
steps.expectedResult: POST /api/schedules and PUT /api/schedules/{id} endpoints maintain acceptable performance under load

postconditions: System successfully handles 100 concurrent schedule edits
All data is saved accurately without corruption
System performance remains within acceptable parameters
No system crashes or critical failures occur

testCases.title: Verify role-based access control prevents non-supervisor users from assigning shifts
preconditions: User account with non-supervisor role exists (e.g., Employee, Viewer)
Role-based access control is configured and active
Schedule creation functionality requires supervisor privileges

steps.action: Log in to the system with a non-supervisor user account
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in with limited role permissions

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the schedule creation page via direct URL or menu
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays authorization error message or redirects to unauthorized page

steps.action: Verify schedule creation menu option is not visible or is disabled
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation option is either hidden from navigation menu or displayed as disabled/grayed out

steps.action: Attempt to access POST /api/schedules endpoint directly (if testing API access)
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized status code with appropriate error message

steps.action: Verify user can only view their own schedule (if applicable to role)
steps.expectedResult: User can access read-only view of their personal schedule but cannot modify or create schedules for others

postconditions: Non-supervisor user is prevented from accessing schedule creation functionality
Security controls are enforced at both UI and API levels
No unauthorized schedule modifications are possible
System maintains proper role-based access control
